Events.html: 1099 – First Crusade: 15,000 starving Christian soldiers march in a religious procession around Jerusalem as its Muslim defenders look on.
Events.text: First Crusade: 15,000 starving Christian soldiers march in a religious procession around Jerusalem as its Muslim defenders look on.

Events.html: 1139 – Song Dynasty general Yue Fei defeats an army led by Jin Dynasty general Wanyan Wuzhu at the Battle of Yancheng during the Jin–Song wars.
Events.text: Song Dynasty general Yue Fei defeats an army led by Jin Dynasty general Wanyan Wuzhu at the Battle of Yancheng during the Jin–Song wars.

links.subject: Jin–Song wars
links.title: Jurchen campaigns against the Song Dynasty

Events.html: 1283 – War of the Sicilian Vespers: Roger of Lauria, commanding the Aragonese fleet defeats an Angevin fleet sent to put down a rebellion on Malta in the Battle of Malta.
Events.text: War of the Sicilian Vespers: Roger of Lauria, commanding the Aragonese fleet defeats an Angevin fleet sent to put down a rebellion on Malta in the Battle of Malta.

Events.html: 1497 – Vasco da Gama sets sail on the first direct European voyage to India.
Events.text: Vasco da Gama sets sail on the first direct European voyage to India.

Events.html: 1579 – Our Lady of Kazan, a holy icon of the Russian Orthodox Church, is discovered underground in the city of Kazan, Tatarstan.
Events.text: Our Lady of Kazan, a holy icon of the Russian Orthodox Church, is discovered underground in the city of Kazan, Tatarstan.

Events.html: 1663 – Charles II of England grants John Clarke a Royal charter to Rhode Island.
Events.text: Charles II of England grants John Clarke a Royal charter to Rhode Island.

Events.html: 1709 – Great Northern War: Battle of Poltava – Peter I of Russia defeats Charles XII of Sweden at Poltava thus effectively ending Sweden's role as a major power in Europe.
Events.text: Great Northern War: Battle of Poltava – Peter I of Russia defeats Charles XII of Sweden at Poltava thus effectively ending Sweden's role as a major power in Europe.

Events.html: 1716 – Great Northern War: the naval Battle of Dynekilen takes place.
Events.text: Great Northern War: the naval Battle of Dynekilen takes place.

Events.html: 1730 – An estimated magnitude 8.7 earthquake causes a tsunami that damages more than 1,000 km (620 mi) of Chile's coastline.
Events.text: An estimated magnitude 8.7 earthquake causes a tsunami that damages more than 1,000 km (620 mi) of Chile's coastline.

Events.html: 1758 – French forces hold Fort Carillon against the British at Ticonderoga, New York.
Events.text: French forces hold Fort Carillon against the British at Ticonderoga, New York.

Events.html: 1760 – French and Indian War: Battle of Restigouche – British forces defeat French forces in last naval battle in New France.
Events.text: French and Indian War: Battle of Restigouche – British forces defeat French forces in last naval battle in New France.

Events.html: 1775 – The Olive Branch Petition is signed by the Continental Congress of the Thirteen Colonies.
Events.text: The Olive Branch Petition is signed by the Continental Congress of the Thirteen Colonies.

Events.html: 1808 – Joseph Bonaparte approves the Bayonne Statute, a royal charter intended as the basis for his rule as king of Spain.
Events.text: Joseph Bonaparte approves the Bayonne Statute, a royal charter intended as the basis for his rule as king of Spain.

Events.html: 1822 – Chippewas turn over a huge tract of land in Ontario to the United Kingdom.
Events.text: Chippewas turn over a huge tract of land in Ontario to the United Kingdom.

Events.html: 1853 – U.S. Commodore Matthew Perry arrives in Edo bay with a treaty requesting trade.
Events.text: U.S. Commodore Matthew Perry arrives in Edo bay with a treaty requesting trade.

Events.html: 1859 – King Charles XV & IV accedes to the throne of Sweden–Norway.
Events.text: King Charles XV & IV accedes to the throne of Sweden–Norway.

Events.html: 1864 – Ikedaya Incident: the Choshu Han shishi's planned Shinsengumi sabotage on Kyoto, Japan at Ikedaya.
Events.text: Ikedaya Incident: the Choshu Han shishi's planned Shinsengumi sabotage on Kyoto, Japan at Ikedaya.

Events.html: 1874 – The Mounties begin their March West.
Events.text: The Mounties begin their March West.

Events.html: 1876 – White supremacists kill five Black Republicans in Hamburg, South Carolina.
Events.text: White supremacists kill five Black Republicans in Hamburg, South Carolina.

Events.html: 1879 – Sailing ship USS Jeannette departs San Francisco carrying an ill-fated expedition to the North Pole.
Events.text: Sailing ship USS Jeannette departs San Francisco carrying an ill-fated expedition to the North Pole.

Events.html: 1889 – The first issue of The Wall Street Journal is published.
Events.text: The first issue of The Wall Street Journal is published.

Events.html: 1892 – St. John's, Newfoundland, Canada is devastated in the Great Fire of 1892.
Events.text: St. John's, Newfoundland, Canada is devastated in the Great Fire of 1892.

Events.html: 1898 – The death of crime boss Soapy Smith, killed in the Shootout on Juneau Wharf, releases Skagway, Alaska from his iron grip.
Events.text: The death of crime boss Soapy Smith, killed in the Shootout on Juneau Wharf, releases Skagway, Alaska from his iron grip.

Events.html: 1912 – Henrique Mitchell de Paiva Couceiro leads an unsuccessful royalist attack against the First Portuguese Republic in Chaves.
Events.text: Henrique Mitchell de Paiva Couceiro leads an unsuccessful royalist attack against the First Portuguese Republic in Chaves.

Events.html: 1932 – The Dow Jones Industrial Average reaches its lowest level of the Great Depression, closing at 41.22.
Events.text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average reaches its lowest level of the Great Depression, closing at 41.22.

Events.html: 1933 – The first rugby union test match between the Wallabies of Australia and the Springboks of South Africa is played at Newlands Stadium in Cape Town.
Events.text: The first rugby union test match between the Wallabies of Australia and the Springboks of South Africa is played at Newlands Stadium in Cape Town.

links.subject: Springboks of South Africa
links.title: South Africa national rugby union team

Events.html: 1937 – Turkey, Iran, Iraq and Afghanistan sign the Treaty of Saadabad.
Events.text: Turkey, Iran, Iraq and Afghanistan sign the Treaty of Saadabad.

Events.html: 1947 – Reports are broadcast that a UFO crash landed in Roswell, New Mexico.
Events.text: Reports are broadcast that a UFO crash landed in Roswell, New Mexico.

Events.html: 1948 – The United States Air Force accepts its first female recruits into a program called Women in the Air Force (WAF).
Events.text: The United States Air Force accepts its first female recruits into a program called Women in the Air Force (WAF).

Events.html: 1960 – Francis Gary Powers is charged with espionage resulting from his flight over the Soviet Union.
Events.text: Francis Gary Powers is charged with espionage resulting from his flight over the Soviet Union.

Events.html: 1962 – Ne Win besieges and dynamites the Rangoon University Student Union building to crush the Student Movement.
Events.text: Ne Win besieges and dynamites the Rangoon University Student Union building to crush the Student Movement.

Events.html: 1966 – King Mwambutsa IV Bangiriceng of Burundi is deposed by his son Prince Charles Ndizi.
Events.text: King Mwambutsa IV Bangiriceng of Burundi is deposed by his son Prince Charles Ndizi.

Events.html: 1968 – The Chrysler wildcat strike begins in Detroit, Michigan.
Events.text: The Chrysler wildcat strike begins in Detroit, Michigan.

Events.html: 1970 – Richard Nixon delivers a special congressional message enunciating Native American self-determination as official US Indian policy, leading to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975.
Events.text: Richard Nixon delivers a special congressional message enunciating Native American self-determination as official US Indian policy, leading to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975.

links.subject: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975
links.title: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975

Events.html: 1982 – Assassination attempt against Iraqi president Saddam Hussein in Dujail.
Events.text: Assassination attempt against Iraqi president Saddam Hussein in Dujail.

Events.html: 1988 – The Island Express train travelling from Bangalore to Kanyakumari derails on the Peruman bridge and falls into Ashtamudi Lake, killing 105 passengers and injuring over 200 more.
Events.text: The Island Express train travelling from Bangalore to Kanyakumari derails on the Peruman bridge and falls into Ashtamudi Lake, killing 105 passengers and injuring over 200 more.

Events.html: 1994 – Kim Jong-il begins to assume supreme leadership of North Korea upon the death of his father, Kim Il-sung.
Events.text: Kim Jong-il begins to assume supreme leadership of North Korea upon the death of his father, Kim Il-sung.

links.subject: supreme leadership
links.title: List of leaders of North Korea

Events.html: 2003 – Delta Goodrem diagnosed with Hodgkin's Lymphoma.

Events.html: 2011 – Space Shuttle Atlantis is launched in the final mission of the U.S. Space Shuttle program.
Events.text: Space Shuttle Atlantis is launched in the final mission of the U.S. Space Shuttle program.
